title: The Dow Is Up 143 Points Because Getting a China Trade Deal Trumps Impeachment Talk
text:
Text size

Impeachment Blinders. The three major U.S. stock market indexes notched gains after the White House released the record of a phone call between President Donald Trump and the president of Ukraine. Hopes for a trade deal with China are overshadowing the unfolding political drama.

That conversation was the focus of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s (D, Calif.) speech late Tuesday afternoon announcing that she was opening an impeachment inquiry into President Trump.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average is up 143 points, or 0.53%, to 26,950.77. The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite are both up 0.3%.

Midday Movers

Philip Morris International stock (ticker: PMI) rose 6.4% – the best performance in the S&P 500 – after Altria Group ’s (MO) CEO said the two tobacco companies could not reach a merger agreement. Altria stock fell 1.7% on the news.

Marathon Petroleum stock (MPC) rose 5.9% after Elliott Management, the activist hedge fund urged the energy firm to split into three separate businesses.

Nike stock (NKE) rose 5.3% after the shoe and apparel giant announced better-than-expected fiscal-first-quarter results.

Broadcom stock (AVGO) fell 3.5% after the chip maker increased the size of its convertible stock offering.
